intro: Schleinitzia novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea schleinitzia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
